TextView.android:text: An intercollegiate BMS feast “INSPIRA’ means ‘INSPIRES” was conducted. As the name rightly suggests, this feast was primarily started with the motive to inspire and grow students.\n

VIHAAN, an initiative by the BMS Department of Mulund College of Commerce aimed to serve the society as well as bring about a change in the society kicked off with a donation drive for Orphan children. Donations accepted in kind the form of stationery items and clothes were offered to the children by the BMS volunteers. VIHAAN also undertook distribution of sweets and fruits in chenani old age home on occasion of Diwali where BMS students celebrated Diwali with the senior citizens.\n

Student Organization for Creative Heads, a part of EDC, started off with a bang. It began with promotional activities such as the Knowledge Tree, Treasure Hunt and an interactive seminar organised by EDC, which was conducted by an alumni of BMS Department Stalls being put up by the students for two days got tremendous response. Think Tank & Quiz too were conducted. The stalls gave an opportunity to the students to gain hands on experience about setting up and running their business. Support, motivation and response received this year has flow made the student committee to wait impatiently for the next SOCH to arrive.\n

The Movie Club – Watch, Think, Share is a club initiated by the BMS Students to have a movie appreciation. The club screens selected movies invite the field experts for interaction on it to gain knowledge on the appreciation of the art. Over 80 students watched the movie AMAL and it was a great learning experience for them.\n

TECHNOBEAT, a 2-day technical fiesta was organized by the BSC IT Dept. The tech fest commenced with a notable seminar on “Ethical Hacking” by none other than Mr. Rizwan Shaikh a well-renowned Ethical Hacker and Computer Security Expert.\n

An initiative of BCAF & BCBI Department: This is the sixth academic year where by students and teachers expressed their opinion through the departmental newsletter - Pratibimb. The newsletter got an overwhelming response from students and staff of other courses and increased from four pages issue to twelve pages. The 38th issue of Pratibimb was released by the end of the Academic year.\n

The first issue of BCFM department Magazine “Finanza” was launched amid much fanfare. The theme of the issue was “Welcome Freshers”. It also included a few insights on the Budget 2014 under the title “Insights” among other finance topics written by students. The second issue was also subsequently launched with much enthusiasm with the theme as “Make in India”.\n

Mulund College of Commerce has continued its efforts in bringing the change in the society through its Intra-collegiate event ‘I CAN CHANGE’ for consecutive third year. This time, the event was for 6 days in the month of August 2014 and five groups came with its various issues. The issues were on ‘Addiction — harmful trend’, ‘Furry Friends’, ‘Garv-Pride and Honour’, ‘I connect’ and ‘Green Computing’. These groups put its effort to create awareness and to influence youngsters towards nation, police, environment, addiction and animals. All of them were focused on their purpose. The ICC student head along with his members took the task of making program successful right from Planning till the execution.\n
